page.title: 11Laverstock Secondary School.
page.content: St Joseph's R.C. Secondary Modern School, is an 11-16 school catering primarily for pupils from the Diocese of Clifton. Recently children from other church demoninations are attending. There are about 250 pupils at present. It was opened in 1962.{The {aim of the school is to create in each {pupil a sound Christian basis on which {to build their present and future {lives.}School begins at 9.10 and ends at 3.55pm. The buildings include an Assembly Hall which serves as a gymnasium and part of it is reserved as a Chapel. This serves the needs of the school and the local Roman Catholic population. The practical block includes an Art Room, a Home Economics Room, a Woodwork Room and Science Laboratories. A three story teaching block contains eight classrooms and a well stocked library.
